1: <sup>1</sup> Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.
2: <sup>2</sup> Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.
3: <sup>3</sup> And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.
4: <sup>4</sup> And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.
5: <sup>5</sup> Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.
6: <sup>6</sup> And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.
7: <sup>7</sup> For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.
8: <sup>8</sup> But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.
9: <sup>9</sup> For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.
10: <sup>10</sup> Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.
11: <sup>11</sup> Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.
12: <sup>12</sup> As touching our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.
13: <sup>13</sup> Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
14: <sup>14</sup> Let all your things be done with charity.
15: <sup>15</sup> I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)
16: <sup>16</sup> That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboureth.
17: <sup>17</sup> I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.
18: <sup>18</sup> For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.
19: <sup>19</sup> The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
20: <sup>20</sup> All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.
21: <sup>21</sup> The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.
22: <sup>22</sup> If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.
23: <sup>23</sup> The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
24: <sup>24</sup> My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
